We're honoring Nikole Hannah-Jones!
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

On Saturday, February 29, we will honor Nikole Hannah-Jones, creator of the acclaimed New York Times 1619 Project observing the 400th anniversary of the advent of American slavery, with the "We The People" award at the ACLU of Pennsylvania's Centennial Celebration Philly.

"Nikole Hannah-Jones is the ideal person to receive this important award. She has been exposing readers to the impacts of racial injustice throughout her distinguished career. Her ground-breaking 1619 Project radicalizes our understanding of our history: how the foundations and consequences of slavery have shaped the story we tell ourselves about who we are as a nation, centering the contributions of Black Americans to our democracy. It is a conversation that is at once timely and long overdue." – Reggie Shuford, executive director of the ACLU-PA.

Read more about Nikole Hannah-Jones.

ACLU Centennial Celebration Philly

Celebrating liberty where it began!

Saturday, February 29, 6:30 - 11 p.m.
Sponsorship Reception: 6 p.m.
National Constitution Center
525 Arch St.
Philadelphia, PA 19106

BUY TICKETS

In addition to having Nikole Hannah-Jones as our special guest, we will also honor the Players Coalition for their impactful work surrounding criminal legal reform.

Special performances by J.S. Ondara, Martha Graham Cracker, and the Brotherly Love, Select Ensemble of the Philadelphia Gay Men's Chorus will also take place.

Get your tickets today!

Sincerely,

ACLU of Pennsylvania
